title: Gross domestic product ( GDP ) growth rate in Lithuania 2024
yAxis: GDP growth compared to previous year
summary: This is a line chart with an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP growth compared to previous year, containing a total of 11 data points.
In general GDP growth compared to previous year has fallen over the Year.
GDP growth compared to previous year is slightly decreasing from 2014 to 2015, slightly increasing from 2015 to 2017, and finally roughly constant from 2017 to 2024.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2016 and 2017.
The highest GDP growth compared to previous year, of value 4.14 was reached at Year 2017
Minimum GDP growth compared to previous year about 2.02 was reached at Year 2015

max_summary: This is a line chart with an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP growth compared to previous year, containing a total of 11 data points.
Overall GDP growth compared to previous year has decreased over the Year.
GDP growth compared to previous year is slightly decreasing from 2014 to 2015, slightly increasing from 2015 to 2017, and finally roughly constant from 2017 to 2024.
The most drastic increase took place within the Year 2016 and 2017.
The highest GDP growth compared to previous year, of value 4.14 was reached at Year 2017
Minimum GDP growth compared to previous year about 2.02 was reached at Year 2015
The line rapidly increased by 76.17% from Year 2016 to 2017.
